Terms & Conditions

The Legal Groundwork for Using Our Website and Services

1. Acceptance of Terms

By accessing or using our website and services, you agree to comply with these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, please refrain from using our services.

2. Description of Services

We offer web development, content creation, documentation, and eLearning services. All services are subject to availability and may be modified at our discretion.

3. Intellectual Property

All content on this website, including text, graphics, logos, and digital materials, is owned by us or our licensors. Reproduction, distribution, or reuse is prohibited without prior written permission.

4. Client Responsibilities

Clients must provide accurate, complete, and timely information and fulfill their responsibilities as agreed upon in individual contracts, scopes, or service agreements.

5. Payment Terms

All payments are due as per the agreed terms outlined in project contracts or proposals. Late payments may incur penalties, interest, or result in service suspension until dues are cleared.

6. Limitation of Liability

We are not liable for any indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages arising from the use of our website or services, including but not limited to loss of data, revenue, or business opportunities.

7. Termination of Services

We reserve the right to suspend or terminate any service at any time, without notice, if there is a breach of these terms or any misconduct. Clients may also terminate services by providing written notice in accordance with contract terms.

8. Governing Law

These Terms of Service are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of India. Any disputes arising shall fall under the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in Bangalore, Karnataka.

9. User Conduct

Users must not misuse our website by knowingly introducing viruses, attempting unauthorized access, or engaging in any illegal, fraudulent, or harmful activities while using our platform or services.

10. Dispute Resolution

In the event of any dispute or claim, both parties agree to first attempt to resolve the matter amicably. If unresolved, the dispute will be settled through binding arbitration in accordance with Indian Arbitration and Conciliation laws, or via a competent court in Bangalore.

11. Changes to Terms

We reserve the right to modify or update these Terms at any time. Any changes will be posted on this page with a revised effective date. Continued use of the site after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

12. Contact Information

If you have questions or concerns about these Terms, please reach out via our official Contact page.
